description: From Middle French funerail, from Latin funereus  +â€Ž -al.

adjectives.description: funereal (comparative more funereal, superlative most funereal)

entries.meaning: Of or relating to a funeral.
Similar to or befitting the mood or elements of a funeral: slow; black colors; formal; dignified or solemn.
examples: There was something menacing and uncomfortable in the funereal stillness, in the muffled, subtle trickle of distant brooks, and in the crowding green peaks and black-wooded precipices that choked the narrow horizon.
